p: Acute febrile illness (AFI) is defined as fever of less than a 1 week of duration, without an identified source of infection that may be accompanied by other symptoms. Many infectious agents have been responsible for this syndrome, including arboviruses. However, the infectious etiology and epidemiology of AFI, remains poorly characterized, especially in low and middle-income countries, where laboratory analysis is hindered by limited resources [ 1, 4, 5].
